by default sessions are launched using

SSM user account with this account the
system does not prompt for a password
when executing root level commands to

first go to the Preferences tab to

click Edit to see the options
enabling run as support allows you to
launch sessions using specific operating
system user accounts instead of the
system-generated account let's enable
run as support for Linux instances
session manager provides two methods for
specifying the user account that is used
to start sessions you can specify an
operating system user name here in
preferences or tag an iam user or role
here we'll set the default to Linux user

session run ass and the linux admin
username as the value tags added to a

any default user set in the session
